title.narrative: MATERNAL AND NEONATAL SERVICES

description.narrative: Maternal and neonatal services apply family-centered approach and support continuum of care in service provision, with a specific focus on Roma and other vulnerable children and mothers., which contributes to Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased percentage of young children, particularly Roma and CWD, benefitting from equitable, gender- sensitive, quality health and other Early Child Development (ECD) services and supportive parental practices

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)

Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Maternal and neonatal services apply family-centered approach and support continuum of care in service provision, with a specificfocus on Roma and other vulnerable children and mothers.

description.narrative: As part of the implementation of the national programme on ‘Protection of Breastfeeding’, new policies, procedures and guidelines are being developed to enable sustainable and quality implementation of health-care practices that support and promote breastfeeding and family-oriented developmental care. Continuity of maternal, neonatal and child health services, particularly for the most vulnerable families and geographic regions, was supported during the COVID-19 pandemic; however, a more systematic approach to addressing perinatal mortality was disrupted due to the pandemic. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/12/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of maternity facilities following updated protocols on neonatal care, including early identification of developmental difficulties in children, principles of Baby-Friendly Hospital Initiative (BFHI) and infection prevention(40387)
